what: Preprocessing and Feature Engineering Steps before Modeling
title: Preprocessing and Feature Engineering Steps before Modeling
text: goal barn provide pipeable functions simplify preprocessing tabular data prior machine learning modeling. Users can combine multiple datasets, define feature engineering steps (creating new predictors nominal numeric columns), split data back preprocessed datasets ready used machine learning workflows.

title: Preprocessing and Feature Engineering Steps before Modeling
text: basic example shows feature engineering:
code: library(barn) full <- tibble::tibble(a = c(1, 2), b = c(2, 1), c = c("M", "M"), y = c(1)) holdout <- tibble::tibble(a = c(1, 1), b = c(2, 2), c = c("R", "M")) harvested <- barn(full, holdout) |>     plant_new_numeric_factors() |>     plant_label_encode() |>     plant_new_nominal_pairs() |>     plant_count_encode() |>     harvest()  full_prep <- harvested[["full"]] full_prep # # A tibble: 2 × 14 #   a_num a_cat b_num b_cat c_cat a_b_cat a_c_cat b_c_cat a_cat_count b_cat_count #   <dbl> <int> <dbl> <int> <int>   <int>   <int>   <int>       <int>       <int> # 1     1     1     2     2     1       1       0       3           3           3 # 2     2     2     1     1     1       3       3       0           1           1 # # ℹ 4 more variables: c_cat_count <int>, a_b_cat_count <int>, a_c_cat_count <int>, # #   b_c_cat_count <int> holdout_prep <- harvested[["holdout"]] holdout_prep # # A tibble: 2 × 14 #   a_num a_cat b_num b_cat c_cat a_b_cat a_c_cat b_c_cat a_cat_count b_cat_count #   <dbl> <int> <dbl> <int> <int>   <int>   <int>   <int>       <int>       <int> # 1     1     1     2     2     2       1       1       4           3           3 # 2     1     1     2     2     1       1       0       3           3           3 # # ℹ 4 more variables: c_cat_count <int>, a_b_cat_count <int>, a_c_cat_count <int>, # #   b_c_cat_count <int>

title: Combine datasets to preprocess — barn
code: full <- data.frame(id = 1:3, p1 = c("A", "B", "C"), p2 = 10:12, y = 1:3) holdout <- data.frame(id = 4:5, p1 = c("D", "E"), p2 = 1:2) original <- data.frame(id = 1:2, p1 = c("F", "G"), p2 = 3:4, y = 4:5) print(barn(full, holdout, original)) #>  #> ── Barn                           ────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> ── Settings                        #> nominal_sufix: _cat #> numeric_sufix: _num #>  #>  #> ── Datasets                        #> # The combined dataset: 7 x 3 #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>   dataset  row_count #>   <chr>        <int> #> 1 full             3 #> 2 holdout          2 #> 3 original         2 #>  #> ── Exploratory Data Analysis       #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   variable type    unique missing #>   <chr>    <chr>    <int>   <int> #> 1 id       numeric      5       0 #> 2 p1       numeric      7       0 #> 3 p2       numeric      7       0
